p:
On May 13, 2014, Panama reported its first imported cases passengers coming from the Dominican Republic and Haiti
29 . Colombia’s first imported cases came from Venezuela, the Dominican Republic, and Panama and were reported more than two months later, in late July
19 . The high migration of travelers between Panama and Colombia facilitates the transmission of diseases between these countries; according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Colombia, in July 2014, there were 34,413 travelers between Panama and Colombia
28 . For the same period, Cartagena was the Colombian city with the third highest number of foreigners (20,800 people)
28 . Therefore, it is possible that the Panamanian strain of CHIKV has entered through Cartagena (Bolivar) and not through SJ-Mahates (50 km away from Cartagena), where the first autochthonous cases were detected
27 .
